items.title: Bolsonaro detained by police ahead of prison sentence
items.summary_auto: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal police custody on Saturday before a planned supporters' vigil near his home, ending months of house arrest as he appealed a Supreme Court conviction for plotting a coup.

items.title: What Alberta's public-private doctor plan could mean for insurance, physician burnout, nurses and more
items.summary_auto: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith’s plan to allow physicians to dabble both in the public and private systems at the same time would be a Canadian first, and has drawn mixed reaction from critics and supporters alike. It has also prompted a number of questions.

items.title: 1 dead, 2 in critical condition after REM train collision on Montreal's South Shore
items.summary_auto: One person is dead and two others are injured after they got hit by a REM train on Montreal's South Shore.

items.title: An unhappy booze industry asks why alcohol was left out of interprovincial trade agreement
items.summary_auto: Some in the alcohol industry say they’re perplexed and disappointed that booze was left out of a recent agreement between provinces to drop interprovincial trade barriers.

items.title: With Bo Bichette testing free agency, here's a look at how the Jays have handled other homegrown stars
items.summary_auto: Bo Bichette is the latest homegrown Toronto Blue Jays star to test the waters of free agency, and it's a moment that could see him part ways with the team. But the Blue Jays organization knows the pressure that comes with trying to keep star players in the fold.

items.title: Reported illnesses have tripled in some school districts. Experts say mental health is a factor
items.summary_auto: A CBC investigation finds that school time lost due to reported illness is up in all districts that provided data — more than tripling in some places compared to five years ago. While the data doesn’t say why, experts say deteriorating mental health is causing some kids to stay home.

items.title: Epstein survivor ‘cautiously optimistic’ about release of case files
items.summary_auto: A survivor of Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse says she and other survivors don’t plan to let up on calls for justice and transparency from the Trump administration until the files on the convicted sex offender are actually released in full.

items.title: Former accomplice of Ryan Wedding turned against him this year, court documents reveal
items.summary_auto: Another one of fugitive Ryan Wedding’s former accomplices has turned against him, CBC News has learned. Records filed in Ontario Superior Court reveal the FBI secured the help of a new informant this year who had “trafficked drugs with Wedding and assisted Wedding with committing multiple murders.”

items.title: Ontario’s rep in Washington says Reagan ad not coming up in talks with U.S. lawmakers
items.summary_auto: The Ontario government’s representative in Washington says the infamous ad that upset U.S. President Donald Trump and ostensibly pushed him to halt trade talks with Canada hasn’t prevented him from having productive meetings.

items.title: Making a health-care complaint is tough. These tips can make the difference
items.summary_auto: For many Canadians, their experience with the health-care system is difficult or uncomfortable but it feels futile to complain. An Ontario doctor and health-care mediator has tips to successfully navigate the complaints sytem and potentially improve care for others.

items.title: ‘I would not have made it out’: Why online spaces matter for 2SLGBTQ+ youth
items.summary_auto: As countries around the world move to ban social media for children under 16, with Nova Scotia and Quebec considering similar legislation, some 2SLGBTQ+ youth say that restricting online access could cut them off from vital communities that allow for identity exploration and support.

items.title: Toy Story is turning 30. But can Pixar recapture its magic?
items.summary_auto: Much of the magic Pixar once commanded seems to have dissipated. And while their original films, from Elemental to Elio, struggle in the box office, films from countries and studios less well-heeled in the world of animation have somewhat usurped their throne. Can they ever get back on top?

items.title: Carney attends G20 summit with aim to boost trade — and as Canada cuts foreign aid
items.summary_auto: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s visit to South Africa for the G20, which will include a meeting with the country’s president, comes as Canada prioritizes boosting trade with other continents and plans to scale back foreign aid.

items.title: Trump loyalist-turned-critic Marjorie Taylor Greene resigning from Congress
items.summary_auto: U.S. Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, a once-loyal supporter of Donald Trump who has become a critic of the president, said Friday she is resigning from Congress in January.

items.title: Manitoba Tories defend reaction to 'politically charged' Transgender Day of Remembrance speech
items.summary_auto: A day after a majority of Manitoba PC MLAs refused to stand in the chamber following a statement recognizing the Transgender Day of Remembrance, NDP members repeatedly heckled the Tories in the legislature, with the premier calling the PC leader a "bigot."

items.title: Canada Post, union agree in principle to deal after 2 years of contentious bargaining
items.summary_auto: Canada Post and the union representing thousands of mail carriers across the country say the parties have reached agreements in principle after two years of contentious bargaining.

items.title: Ottawa, Alberta expected to sign new energy sector deal on Thursday: source
items.summary_auto: Prime Minister Mark Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith are expected to sign an agreement on the future of Alberta's energy sector on Thursday, according to a senior federal government source.

items.title: Waterboarding, sexual assault, disguises: Details of terrifying $2M B.C. bitcoin hostage-taking revealed
At 83, Paul McCartney takes Hamilton crowd through longest list of greatest hits any artist ever had
items.summary_auto: In Hamilton Friday night, McCartney led a grateful, sold-out crowd on a magical history tour starting in Liverpool with the Beatles' first number one hit single, From Me To You. His show opened the newly renovated TD Coliseum.

items.title: ByHeart baby formula recalled in Canada as infant botulism cases in U.S. climb
items.summary_auto: Canadian officials are warning the public not to consume recalled ByHeart Whole Nutrition Infant Formula because it may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum tied to infant illnesses in the U.S.

items.title: New Ken Burns series features Indigenous nations' role in American Revolution
items.summary_auto: Ken Burns’s new documentary series on the American Revolution includes history often left out of textbooks: the economic and diplomatic roles sovereign Indigenous nations had in the creation of the United States.

items.title: Top court says federal prisoners can challenge security transfer denials before judge
items.summary_auto: The Supreme Court of Canada has ruled federal inmates can challenge the refusal to transfer them to lower security prisons on the grounds their liberty is deprived.

items.title: Teachers were 'heroes' in protecting students from grizzly attack on B.C.'s Central Coast, officials say
Some stars of new Fox News Bible podcast say they didn't know it was happening
items.summary_auto: This week, Fox News Media announced the Life Of Jesus podcast, featuring actors such as Kristen Bell and Brian Cox. Following the announcement, Bell and Cox have said they didn't know about the project until now.

items.title: A wildfire reduced this B.C. fire hall to rubble in 2023. Now, they're rebuilding
items.summary_auto: After operating out of a storage facility for the last two and a half years, construction on the new Scotch Creek Fire Hall has begun in B.C. 's Shuswap region.

items.title: Trump and Mamdani praise each other after meeting face to face at White House
Fans heartbroken, angry as Winnipeg's Valour FC announces suspension of operations
items.summary_auto: Winnipeg's professional men's soccer club, Valour FC, announced Friday it has suspended operations.
